subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Biggest Turbines on Earth
description: Learn The Biggest Turbines on Earth in one minute.

hook.text: The largest wind turbine in the world has blades longer than a football field.

buildup.text: Each blade sweeps an area larger than the London Eye Ferris wheel.

discovery.text: A single rotation of these giant blades can power a home for two full days.

twist.text: Bigger turbines catch more wind at higher altitudes where it blows faster.

climax.text: One modern offshore turbine produces enough power for 20,000 homes per year.

punchline.text: The bigger the blade, the more wind it can turn into watts.

quiz.question: How many homes can a single large offshore turbine power per year?
